4.2. How To Write a Literature Review Essay For Any Academic Research Paper, Coursework or Thesis
How to write a literature review essay for any academic research paper, coursework or thesis: A comprehensive guide
There are always many sources of information that researchers, writers and students have to consider and review. A literature review is a process of summarizing this information and producing a review of this summary.
The literature review can be very diverse. It can start from a single source, and you can build the review from there. If you have very big sources to review, you may have to spend more time and efforts for this process as you can only build the literature summary from that big source alone.
A literature review can cover any topics according to the scope of your research and its purpose. If you are doing a research and your aim is to answer a research question or to test a research hypothesis, your sources should be related to this aim.
To write a good literature review, you need to follow a certain structure and process. 
In this comprehensive guide, we would like to help you not only in building your sources by explaining which ones are fit to include in your review, but we would also like to provide you with different methods and tools of how you may present your literature review, so that you have all you need to write an excellent literature review paper or any other assignment. In this article, you will learn how to write a literature review paper effectively, and you’d be sure to improve your writing skills. 

## Why You Need a Literature Review
This section aims to answer the question, why you need a literature review.
Literature review forms an integral part of a research proposal and for all research types. When you need an extensive answer or a short answer regarding a particular research topic, a literature review can provide you a better answer than the direct search for the answer.
It also helps you to understand a research topic more. You may find yourself in a situation with the lack of a research question or the lack of a clear research hypothesis when you would write a literature review.
When you review and summarize your research literature, you can start with the aim of your own research. Also, you will start your research and research plan by using the sources that you have compiled. So, you may avoid the problem of a lack of a research question and hypothesis.
A literature review can help you to find a lot of valuable information that you can use to improve on your own research and research methods. When you are conducting a study or doing a research, there is always a possibility of making errors or mistakes. Therefore, you do not want to make the same mistakes again. 
With the help of your literature review, you can find examples of other researches, so that you can see mistakes that were also made by others. You can also use these examples to improve your own research methods.
With your literature review, you can find a lot of related and similar researches, so that you can improve the existing research and do your own research in the similar way.

## What is a Literature Review?
A literature review is an in-depth review of the research related to a topic. It explains the importance of the research and what is the context of the research. 
A literature review consists of a summary of all the previous published literature on a subject. It helps the researcher understand and present their own points of view more clearly. 
This section will give you an explanation of what a literature review is. It will provide you with an example of some literature review writing styles. Also, some of these styles will be described in detail. It will help you to clarify the role of a literature review and to explain when and how you may use literature review in your papers and assignments. 
The literature review paper can be very brief or very long. If you write a brief literature review, you will focus only on the key points and you will be focusing on those points that help the reviewer understand a certain thing that the authors are not saying. The reviewer may not understand where they should focus.
A literature review can be very long. Sometimes it can even be a research paper. In that case, you may include all the sources or you may just focus on certain topics as you write your own research paper. As you write the paper, you may decide to remove some sources since you may find their results controversial and irrelevant to your research topic or results.

### Types
The following are some examples of types of a literature review.
Content review
Summary review 
Formative review 
Analytical review

#### Content review
A content review can be an in-depth review of the content of all the published articles and essays of a specific topic. 
It also includes summary, descriptive, and interpretive elements.

#### Summary review
A summary review can be shorter in content than a content review, but it may also have a deeper analysis of the literature. It only focuses on the main themes and key points of the existing literature. Summary review can be less time-consuming when compared to the content review.

#### Formative review
Formative review looks at the current body of the literature and it focuses on the way the existing literature contributes to the development of contemporary research in one area.

#### Analytical review
A critical literature review is an in-depth critical examination of what scholars have done. It identifies what scholars have done and the gaps between the body of research and the body of the theory.

## Literature Review in English
A literature review is a section of a research paper on a specific topic that summarizes the findings of the previous published research, and gives a brief overview of the research topic that is yet to be done.
Literature review is one of the most important sections that help a scientist or a researcher to get more information and understanding about a research topic. It allows them to write in an organized and structured way.

### Why Should You Use a Literature Review?
These are the reasons that may support your thought of using a literature review in your article.
A literature review will help you to find existing similar research.
A literature review will help you to check the existing errors and flaws.
Literature review will help you to improve your research methods and to find more related research.
A literature review will help you to answer your research questions and improve your research hypothesis by using related existing research.

## How to write a literature review
In this section, we will tell you how to write a literature review. We will also give you useful advice and some writing tips and tricks. This section is important. It will help you to write a good literature review. Therefore, this information and advice will be very helpful to all researchers and writers and students that need to write a literature review. 

### Steps
The following information will give you a detailed overview of the steps that you may need to follow to write a literature review. 
It will describe the basics and show you how you may write literature reviews. If you have time, try to follow the steps of writing a literature review in the order given by these steps. This will help you to have all your requirements in order, and you will be able to achieve your aim. 

##### Define the problem
First of all, you need to define the problem that you are writing your literature review about. You need to understand and express clearly and precisely the problem of the article that you are writing. When you define the problem, it will help you to understand what you need to write. 
A good example of this can be writing a literature review on the problem of writing an essay. If you have your research question: What is needed in writing an essay, the problem will be understood better and you will be able to write a good literature review on that specific research questions with your own point of view.

##### Analyze existing literature
Now when you understand the aim of your research, try to analyze and summarise the existing literature in a general way for that specific topic. You may use a range of sources for this as you are doing a literature review.
Remember that when you are analyzing and summarising the sources, there are several techniques that may be used. Some of these techniques will be shown to you later in this article. These techniques will help you to get more relevant and credible sources and they will also help you to summarize the main points and general views of existing literature. 

##### Develop your own approach
Now when you have summarized the literature, you may develop your own approach and analysis in the next step. This step is the most important one for your research and it will help you to express your own views in the literature review. 
This step will also help a reader to have an overall understanding of your own view of this research topic. Some of these points that you may include are :
the purpose of the topic
the problem it is solving
the methodology to be used
the current research and research question
the aims and objectives for your own research in this topic
the gap in the existing literature.
the general points and views that may be considered for the topic
the key research questions that need to be answered or need to be proved
the research methods that need to be used to explore a particular topic

##### Develop your own research
Now when you have finished developing your own approach and analysis in the preceding step, the next step is to write your own research and research plan for that topic. 
In this step, your aim will be to formulate a clear research question and define a possible way to find an answer to that research question. You may also develop the research process that you will use to explore and evaluate the topic. 
This is because your research may also help a reader to understand how you approached the topic and why you tried to explore the topic in the way you did.

##### Review the literature
The last step is to review the literature. This is also considered a literature review as it summarizes the existing literature. It may be a general point review or a specific point that you would like to consider, as you analyze and summarize the existing literature in this step. 

### How to Write a Literature Review Structure
The following structure will help you to start and to finalize your literature review. It will help you to write good and clear research.
Literature review essay Structure 
| What Does Your Research Say?  
Background: | Summary of Literature | 
• Explain the Background of your Literature Review
• Summarize existing key research ideas, issues or practices   
Overview: | Your Research | 
• Discuss your background information and identify key research needs
• Explain the purpose of your Literature Review  
Analysis: | Your Own Research | 
• Identify research questions and key literature-based research topics
• Discuss the theoretical framework
• Identify methods and findings for your proposed study  
Conclusion: | Conclusions | 
• Summarize what you found in your Literature Review
• Make general implications and a final statement about your research
• Reflect on the Research Process  

### Example
Below, we will provide an example of a structure that can be used to write a quality literature review. 
You are free to write the structure in the order as you may see and find appropriate for you. Also, you may read the structure more than one time. It will help you to get to know the entire structure.

#### Example #1
When writing the literature review part of a research paper or an assignment, you need to focus on the key points in the research paper. The research paper may be related to medicine or education. The topic in your research paper will always be the same. It will be the main focus of your research paper.  
In your research paper, you want to explore a particular question or a particular topic. The point of your research paper will be, what is the answer to this question or what is your solution to this topic?  
When you write a literature review, you want to include all the sources you used to find the answer to the question. When you write a literature review, you will look at all published research of any kind related to your topic. The sources may be scientific articles or any other literature related to that topic. You have to explore and summarise these sources to find a better answer or clear picture of your research topic.  
When summarising the literature, your job is to summarize the key findings of the research papers. You need to analyze and interpret all these reviews and you need to select the most important and helpful for your research sources. Also, you need to focus only on your own topic and not get distracted by the other topics that may be covered in any review paper or any other source that you have to use. 

#### Example #2
When you begin to write a literature review report, you will look at all published research papers and articles, magazines, etc., on that topic that you have chosen in your research paper.   
The research paper will be written on education. The research question of this topic may be: What are the key ideas that are used in education?   
Your literature review will include all the research findings that you find after searching. In this case, the researcher will have to search different sources and magazines related to education. These sources may be articles or research papers or any other information that the researcher can find.   
When you write the literature review, you need to analyze all the sources that you find and you need to select the best sources for this review. It is not necessary that you have to include all sources of information about that topic. Some of the reviews you will use may be redundant. However, some of your review sources may be important and they will help you to have a better answer to your research question. ### What is a Tenant?

In land administration, a tenant is a person who occupies an asset, often a house or a floor of a house. Tenants, in addition, often do not reside in their tenants and are allowed to rent apartments to different individuals or businesses, both for temporary and ongoing purposes. A landlord is the individual or company the tenants pay rent to. The tenant receives a residence and is often offered the right to utilize the property they live in.

Tenant leases are contracts that specify how and when the tenant can lease the property and the specific charges, if any, included with the rental. The tenant agreement or rental agreement describes the terms and conditions of renting a residence. The tenant agreement also explains the tenant's responsibilities for maintenance of their property.

## What is the Difference between Ownership and Tenancy?

Ownership is the most significant difference between renting and possessing a house, the landlord, and the tenant. The owner is the proprietor of the house. When possessing a property, the owner pays property taxes. They pay their homeowner's insurance and get their properties' depreciation. The owner is additionally liable for any maintenance, redecoration, or restorations that need to be done to their home. In contrast to the owner, the tenant pays no property taxes, and they do not repay a mortgage on their residence.

In addition, renters do not possess the home and hold no claim to the asset. Hence, if the owner sells the property and the property's value changes, tenants have no claim to the capital gain. While ownership involves the right to stay in the house as much as the proprietor wishes, tenants are expected to return the property into the condition they kept it before their lease ended. On the other hand, the property's owner typically has the right to demolish the house whenever he/she wishes - for example, a property owner may demolish an apartment building to build another building that will have multiple units.

> Owning a house typically involves no rental income, whereas the landlord of an apartment building may generate extra income from tenants of one or two households within the building.

>

## Who Is the Tenant in a Real Estate Law Case?

Tenants and landlords are typically mentioned to contrast the rights and responsibilities that each party has. The tenant and the landlord are mentioned in connection with commercial leases and residential leases.

### Residential Lease

A residential lease is a written contract between a tenant and a landlord to occupy a rental residential building. Most residential leases include several pages of language that the tenant must carefully read and understand, as well as a one-page landlord page. Both landlords and tenants agree to follow the lease's terms throughout the lease duration.

Generally, the lease specifies the landlord's and tenant's responsibilities during the lease. For example, both parties must respect the tenant's right to privacy. Tenants must be allowed to fix things that break, unless it requires professional assistance or the services of the landlord's general contractor or engineer.

Tenant leases frequently have rental payment terms (like rent is due on the first of each month) and legal clauses that indicate what both parties can do if the other tries to break the lease during the lease duration.

For example, a clause might state that if the tenant pays late, then the tenant agrees to pay a late penalty fee and pay all future missed payments for the lease. Additionally, tenant-landlord contracts sometimes specify how both parties should address a landlord's unreasonable request (for example, a tenant requesting the landlord provide a refrigerator, although the lease doesn't expressly state the landlord must provide a refrigerator).

### Commercial Lease

A commercial lease is a written contract that spells out the rights and responsibilities of a commercial tenant and a commercial landlord. Tenant companies typically are leasing commercial real estate like office buildings and hotel suites for use as a business building. The tenant will also be leasing a property from the landlord.

The tenant and the landlord each have specific roles and responsibilities. The landlord's responsibilities include preserving the property, making repairs and restorations when necessary, keeping the building running safely, and keeping the building clean. The tenant must uphold all lease terms and comply with all legal lease clauses, as well as maintaining the property as required and making periodic roof repairs, for instance.

Commercial rental agreements can be complex and may require more than a couple of pages to explain everything, which can be difficult for the layperson to understand. This makes it vital to consult an attorney before signing a landlord-tenant agreement. It's even more vital to consult a lawyer if the lease involves complex property rights and the parties are uncertain about their rights and responsibilities under the lease.

> Tenants may not enter into a lease unless the landlord has completed both the tenant's and landlord's rights and responsibilities before allowing the tenant to sign the lease.

>

>

> Tenants may not enter into a lease until each party has completed both the tenant's and landlord's rights and responsibilities. Tenants may not enter into a tenancy until a tenant and landlord have mutually agreed upon and understood a written lease.

>

## Why is Tenant Liability Important in Land Administration Law?

Since tenant liability deals with the protection of both the landlord and the tenants and their assets, landlord-tenant law is central to modern society. Without tenant liability, landlords can evict tenants for many reasons and force tenants into situations they don't want to go through. Tenants could be unable to have access to the right to live in their property, which can be problematic because the right to live in one's home is fundamental to one's personhood.

Tenant claims can be based off negligence on the part of the landlord and the landlord's knowledge of the condition of the property. Tenants can file a claim if the unit they rent is defective so they cannot live in it. Tenants can also file claims for other damages that they believe the landlord could have prevented if he had taken the necessary steps. Tenant claims can be for damage to the property of the landlord, the tenant, or a third party. These claims can be based on the landlord's failure to complete work around the tenant's home or a failure to inspect the property sufficiently.

Tenants will often file a claim if the landlord has violated tenant law by violating an ordinance that protects them. Ordinances have been created to protect tenants from unreasonable conditions in the home. When a tenant's health and safety are at risk because of a condition in the home, the tenant can file a claim.

## Examples of Tenant Liability Cases

In some places in the United States, tenant liability law is more stringent than in other states. One example is landlord-tenant law in California.

For instance, it is illegal for Californians to refuse rental payments within 35 days of the lease being signed. Landlords must have a valid lease that the tenant has signed in order to have the authority to evict a tenant. Landlords can also charge tenants a nominal non-payment fee that will be returned to the tenant if the payment is made before the end of the 35-day period.

Landlords must also allow tenants 30 days to move out before any evictions can be made in California. As well, tenants cannot be evicted if their landlord is behind in any housing-related fee.

Many land administration laws will place stringent penalties on landlords who violate tenant liability laws and cause tenants to be harassed or suffer damages. While some jurisdictions have harsh penalties for landlords who commit these offenses, California, for example, has penalties on landlords who fail to pay rent or violate tenant protection law. A landlord that fails to pay their rent will have the property sold and the money will be given to the unpaid tenant. In addition, fines can be levied on the landlord.

## What Is Negligence of a Tenant?

Negligence is defined in the property contract as a failure to take care of a tenant's property. Negligence can come from the tenant not taking care of their own home, such as leaving their appliances on accidentally or not having their tenants properly maintained. It can also come from an illegal move on the part of a tenant, such as breaking pipes with a hammer or making illegal renovations.

These sorts of actions can result in the landlord seeking a claim against the tenant. In cases involving negligence on the part of the tenant, the tenant has the right to refuse to make any repairs the tenant doesn't approve with or they don't agree to a certain type of repair. The right to refuse can be used when refusing to let a landlord make an electrical upgrade or when refusing to accept a plumber's inspection of the home.

These actions can be illegal, however, and a court can grant a tenant's claim if it finds that there was an illegal action on the part of the tenant or that the tenant violated tenant law. In this case, the landlord can be reimbursed any damages incurred for them, such as damages for a leaky pipe and damages for the broken leg.

## Does Tenant Liability Differ From Landlord Liability?

Tenants can be held liable for damages and their own negligence and that of any third party they invite into the home.

Landlords, on the other hand, can be held liable for damages to their properties and the negligent behavior of third parties they invite.

## Is the Law of Tenancy Enacted at the State or Municipal Level?

The law of tenancy varies considerably from state to state, making it very important that any land administration and real estate-related issue is discussed with a lawyer familiar with your state's laws. Although some states have much less stringent laws than others, in all cases the law in place is enforced by local governments or municipalities.

## What Are the Common Issues in Land Administration Laws on Tenancy?

There are three primary issues when it comes to tenant liability.

### Damages to Landlord Property

Tenants will often file a claim for damages to the property of the landlord. Since tenant liability deals with protecting landlords and tenants who own homes, tenants could sue the landlord for any damages they cause their own property. The landlord could also be sued if they damaged the property of the tenant or a third party that moved in the house.

> Property in California is often protected from damages from tenants if they properly maintain their properties and do not make illegal repairs.

>

For example, in California, tenants are unable to cause damage to the property of the landlord or a third party without first being granted permission. A tenant is unable to claim a claim for damages to the property of the landlord if their actions were not illegal or improper.

### Harassment

Another factor that can lead to the tenant being legally liable for a landlord is if a tenant harasses a landlord. In the case of harassment, the tenant can be sued by the landlord for any damages they suffer that the tenant did not cause. Furthermore, landlords can sue tenants they harass. Tenants that harass landlords in California are subject to a $1,000 fine and two to six months in jail.

### Tenant Liability

Tenants can also be held liable for landlord-specific damages or for another tenant's damages that were the culprit of the problem. Tenant liability involves a landlord suing a tenant for their damage to the property, or the landlord might file against a tenant who broke into the property to repair a plumbing pipe.

### Tenant Protection

Finally, tenants can be sued if they engage in a violation of their property that disrupts their peaceful and well-being. Tenants could be sued for any damage done if they are making noise or using the property for their own benefit at the detriment of the homeowner.

## How to Avoid Tenant Liability Issues

There are a few actions that landlords can take to protect themselves from tenant liability. While there are many factors in a landlord-tenant agreement that will affect how the landlords and tenants can interact, all states have a common law rule that landlords must follow in order to be protected.

### The Fair Housing Clause and the Homeowners' Equity Clause

Both of these clauses are meant to protect tenants from harassment. Harassment is illegal in all states and the federal government will penalize any tenant that breaches this law. The Fair Housing Act says that landlords are not allowed to refuse to rent to any tenant because of their race, religion, sex, or disability.

The Fair Housing Act is very detailed when it comes to protecting tenants' rights, including the right to use a bathroom of the tenant's choosing. A landlord cannot use their right of access in an unlawful manner, although the landlord's right of access is still protected, so a landlord could not stop a tenant of a handicapped person from using the bathroom if they can still give the tenant the right of access.

### Rent Control

In some states, rental control has been made possible by laws on the part of a state or municipal government. In these states, landlords are legally prohibited from increasing or reducing rent because of the tenants' income. They can change the terms of the contract if they wish and make it legally binding, but they must present the tenants with the new terms before they sign the lease if the tenant has the right to refuse to sign the contract.

States that do not have rent control can force landlords to limit how they decide what prices to charge their tenants. State-or-municipal rent control laws have been debated over the last several decades. These laws, although their effectiveness is questionable, have made their way out of court and made the way tenants and landlords can interact more reasonable.

### Fair Housing and Equal Protection Clause

The Equal Protection Clause in the U.S. Constitution says that no state or municipal government can discriminate against anyone because of who they are. In some states, housing discrimination can result in criminal charges and fines imposed by the state's prosecutor. This means that a landlord cannot discriminate based off race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and race.

### Tenant Rights

Many state laws restrict their tenants' rights to certain things, such as landlords refusing to rent to tenants because of their gender. Tenants who are discriminated against by a landlord can sue the landlord for damages and the cost of the lawsuit. Tenants are also entitled to legal counsel in eviction proceedings.

## Tenant Liability FAQ

### What Is Included in Landlord-Tenant Contract?

The main components of a landlord-tenant contract are usually found at the very beginning of the contract. There is typically a list of items such as who the landlord is, which tenant is renting the property, the rent for the property, and the terms of the contract, including the terms of the lease, conditions of the lease, rights and responsibilities of all parties, and notices for all parts of the contract.

### What Are the Four Rights of a Good Commercial Tenant?

There are a few rights that a landlord and a decent tenant have to work together. These rights are (1) protection from landlord harassment, (2) a rental payment, (3) a lease term, and (4) access to the property.

### What Are the Nine Tenant Rights in California?

There are nine rights that tenants possess in California. They are (1) the right to refuse service, (2) the right to refuse services, (3) a right to be removed from property or to cause someone to be removed from the property, (4) a right to repair property, (5) to choose any repairs or other services provided by the landlord on behalf the tenant, (6) a right to inspect property, (7) right to make payments without giving permission, (8) right to repair any damage and (9) right to live in the property while being repaired.

### Does California Have Different Tenant Protection Laws?

California has slightly different laws than other states when it comes to tenant protection. For instance, tenants do not have a right to be removed from the property in some circumstances but do have the right to refuse services.

### Is Landlord and Tenant a Legal Relationship?

Landlord and tenant is a relationship that can be regulated by the state court and by any agreement between the landlord and tenant that describes their rights and responsibilities. This can be a verbal agreement that the tenants and landlord reach or an agreement put in written form. If a verbal agreement can be changed to a written agreement, it can be done. There are many cases where tenants and landlords reach out to negotiate the lease before signing, allowing them to change or put in extra clauses.

### What Is Landlord-Tenant Law?

A landlord-tenant law is a code of laws in place to protect tenants and landlords and their property. This is one major area of law that governs tenants and landlords and can affect the relationship between them. Tenants and landlords can be sued if they are not compliant with these laws. This includes eviction laws, harassment laws, repair laws and more.

## The Bottom Line

Land administration law is crucial for tenants and landlords. Tenant liability is a common area of real estate and property law as well. Tenant liability laws can impact the rent a tenant pays to the owners and it can affect the rights of tenants and the rights of owners. These rights can often be negotiated prior to signing a lease. Land law deals with legal protection for tenants and landlords and how they can have their rights protected legally.

instruction: What is the difference between civil law and criminal law? Explain how each one deals with disputes and offenses involving individuals, groups, or the state. Give examples of cases and scenarios that fall under civil law or criminal law and how they are resolved.
